comments.body: can you review changes and make sure we're adding all new APIs?
I updated some stuff that I found missing!
Shouldn't this be `boolean` instead of `true`?
FIxed in #21342
Should be `boolean`, I guess.
FIxed in #21342
Mentioning definition owners for review: @tkqubo @bumbleblym @bcherny @tommytroylin @mohsen1 @jcreamer898 @ahmed-taj @alan-agius4 @elliottsj @jason0x43
string?
I've been using `any` in a few places like this as a stop gap till I am able to figure out what all the types are...
In the schema, it references `ruleSet-loader` too, but it's redundant, since `ruleSet-use` references `ruleSet-use-item`, and `ruleSet-use-item` references `ruleSet-loader`.
Modified this because I've noticed the unused `CommonArrayOfStringOrStringArrayValues`.
I wasn't sure whether or not to add extra documentation here, since this looks to be straight from the webpack config schema
why this and `process` can't be `"empty"`?

https://webpack.js.org/configuration/node/#node-console
https://webpack.js.org/configuration/node/#node-process
ü§î

see https://webpack.js.org/configuration/node/#node-process

try it
```
node: {
        process: 'empty'
}

npm run build
```

Output result
```
> webpack --config webpack.development.js

Invalid configuration object. Webpack has been initialised using a configuration object that does not match the API schema.
 - configuration.node should be one of these:
   false | object { Buffer?, __dirname?, __filename?, console?, global?, process?, ‚Ä¶ }
   -> Include polyfills or mocks for various node stuff.
   Details:
    * configuration.node should be false
    * configuration.node.process should be one of these:
      false | true | "mock"
      -> Include a polyfill for the 'process' variable
```

I agree with the class vs interface. That said, I guess that brings me to a question around how to treat private APIs in type defs. Webpack doesn't export that util at their top-level (see https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/HEAD/lib/webpack.js#L165); in other words, I'm not sure if users are intended to do `new SortableSet([])` at all. That's why I made it an interface vs a class. To import `SortableSet` you'd have to do something like `import {} from 'webpack/lib/util/SortableSet`.

Happy to change to a class‚Äîit's a quick change. However, I'm unclear on how to handle due to the above. I could even put `SortableSet` in a `util` namespace, but ultimately you wouldn't actually be importing the class in Javascript. Let me know your thoughts.

This cannot be a private since it‚Äôs being used by an exported member.

If the sortableset is not meant to be used as a class, I don‚Äôt have any problem with the current implementation using an interface.

That said, I am gonna loop in @Hotell, for another option.

yo folks! sorry to be kinda late to the party. If `SortableSet` is a runtime entity ( which is -> class ) it should be typed as runtime executable , in our case a es2015 class. Also it should be moved under proper path like within implementation, so consumer wont be able to do `const {SortableSet} = require('webpack')`
Argument should be an array of those types.
Can you declare this somewhere and use it her and in line 49? Naming is up to you but I would name it `ConfigurationFunction`
I did before and the linter broke alerting that it can be a union type, the fix was directly pointed by the linter itself
Should I declare the whole options as a type? ü§î
@rubenspgcavalcante this is in express merge but I haven't merged it because it sounds like you're still considering a change here. Please let me know if that isn't the case. Thanks!

For me looks ok @jessetrinity, you can merge :)
thanks in advance!

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +58,62 @@    options:
        | webpack.Configuration[]
        | ((
              env: string | Record<string, boolean | number | string>,
              args: Record<string, string>,

comments.body: @rubenspgcavalcante, what do you think about extending `args` with known values? I don't know if there are any other ones, but the following would fit my needs: ```ts args: Record & { mode?: "development" | "production" | "none" }, ``` (Obviously exported as its type to be reused for `MultiConfigurationFactory` as well) We can see at https://webpack.js.org/configuration/mode/ that `args.mode` is expected to be there.
FYI, I opened https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/40262 with this. ü§û

I know this PR isn't updating the types for a newer version of webpack, but I think it would still be a good idea to bump up the version at the top of this file to 4.41. This PR has a few breaking changes and if someone does get broken they can go back to the 4.39 type definitions.

Thanks for the feedback üëç
Agree with that and increased the version to `4.41` accordingly.

I've also checked if there were new changes to introduced in this release to the affected types but nothing changed there.
